I am thrilled to be here when Pepe Mujica left the Uruguayan government.
Pepe is not only committed to all of Uruguay's important interests but also to Brazil and other Latin American countries.
Pepe is committed to democracy and human rights. I have the honor to be here at this special time.
From our bilateral relations, we have proven that it is possible to achieve greater approximation and integration between our countries through common actions.
This is the first investment of Eletrobras abroad, in partnership with UTE, Uruguay.
It is part of a vision of integration between Brazil and Uruguay, and is a model that we have to follow to build other countries with our integration.

I am sure that relations between Brazil and Uruguay will be deepened with the arrival of President Tabaré.
I am committed to working shoulder to shoulder with him every day, both in our relations and in multilateral relations.
We will work to ensure that we have a Latin America of Pepe Mujica's dreams: democratic, libertarian and developed.
